200010004.text:
Hey, I said my spear can pierce anything.
It has to be able to pierce your shield!

200010005.text:
No, I said my shield can block anything.
It blocked your spear!

200010006.text: (I used to play like them when I was young. It'd be nice to get some wooden toys for those kids.)

200010007.text:
You want to make a toy spear and shield?
Don't you think you're too old for those? Are they for your nephews and nieces?

200010008.text: Well, you don't have to tell me if you don't want to.

200010009.text: I want to give them as toys to two village children.

200010010.text:
What? Wow, you're one of the kindest people I've ever met.
All right, I'm feeling generous today. I'll make them for you for free. Just give me a moment.

200010011.text:
Let's see what I can do. Come on, come on! Yes!
Let me do this... All right! And the finishing touch!

200010012.text:
Here! It's finished! I haven't made anything like this for a long time.
They're all yours.

200010014.text:
I hope the children like them.
Take care.

200010015.text: Whoa, are you really giving these to us?

200010017.text:
Ere, but <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>his</> spear didn't look like this...
Ah, well, who cares? Get ready for the best spear in the world!

200010018.text: I'll block it with the best shield in the world!

200010019.text: (The children seem to like their presents.)

200010020.text:
Well, I've been at the Forge for much longer than you have.
You're no match for me.

200010021.text:
Hmph, it doesn't matter how long you've been here.
If you want to talk about skills, I once was a senior Forgekeeper!

200010022.text:
But that was years ago.
And do you have proof? Any at all?

200010023.text: Proof? Isn't my <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>steel visor</> proof enough?

200010025.text:
Come on, you know that steel visor that the man with a scar on his face took with him.
You were more excited about it than I was.

200010026.text: Ah, that steel visor! I do. I couldn't believe you made such a great piece.

200010027.text: What did you say just now?

200010028.text: Okay, okay. I have to admit that your steel visor was great.

200010030.text:
Looking for a temporary Fissure research assistant.
The job entails collecting specimens from the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Bottomless Pit</> nearby.

200010031.text:
Physical strength and self-defense skills required.
Able warriors who can defeat the monsters in the Pit preferred.

200010032.text:
Anyone who manages to reach the house on the northeast side of the Pit will be hired on the spot.
But as your recruitment test, pick up an apple from a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Thiefhog</> along the way. - <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kunale</> -

200010034.text: (She must be <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kunale</>. I should talk to her.)

200010035.text:
A person!
What's a person doing here?

200010037.text:
No, no! It's not like that. As you can see, this neighborhood is a dangerous place, and we don't have that many visitors.
I almost mistook you for a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hollow</> and attacked you with a sickle!

200010038.text:
Oh, where are my manners? I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kunale</>, and I'm currently researching the Fissure here.
Ah, we've met before, haven't we? I remember that you were collecting the Hollow's cores earlier!

200010039.text:
Let's see... Yes, you were quite skilled.
Are you interested in making some money? This is not an easy job, though.

200010040.text: What do I need to do?

200010041.text:
(Taking a close look at the body...
It looks different from the Hollows I've fought so far.)

200010042.text:
(Maybe this is a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>unique specimen</>.
I should take it to Kunale.)

200010043.text: Here are the specimens you asked for.

200010044.text: This is in good condition... same here... same here... wah?

200010045.text: (I'll relay the details as best I can...)

200010046.text: I've never seen anything like this before! Where did you find it?

200010047.text:
Oh, my! Oh, my! Oh... my! I've never seen a specimen like this.
The Hollow that left this... Can I even refer to it as a Hollow? I think it's something else entirely!

200010048.text: I'll help you, but you need to calm down first.

200010049.text:
My goodness! How could I calm down? If I could get my hands on this <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>organism</>, I could...
Ah, my apologies. I'm just so excited... I mean, thank you!

200010050.text: (Judging by what Kunale said, the owner of this specimen must be stronger than a normal Hollow.)

200010051.text: (By hunting this being, I'll be able to collect the samples that she wants. I should take a look around.)

200010052.text: Welcome back! Did you get the organism samples I want?

200010053.text: Here, Kunale, the samples you wanted.

200010054.text:
Thank you, thank you so much! Mwa hah hah!
You've helped me establish a strong foundation for my Fissure research.

200010055.text:
I can't wait to look into these.
Here's your reward. Thank you!

200010056.text:
Oh, it was you.
Of course. You might be able to do me a favor.

200010058.text:
I'm sure you know something about the "Fables."
There might already a few in the Bottomless Pit.

200010059.text:
I say "might" because I've only heard rumors about it,
and I've never seen an actual Fable in the Bottomless Pit.

200010060.text:
Ah, just wait a minute, and I'll write it down.
Yes, so? Yes. Indeed. Yes, yes. Please continue.

200010061.text:
I've written it all down. Most of it I already know, but there are a few interesting theories there.
It's a shame I can't see it for myself, but... I don't have any plans to go there in person.

200010062.text:
(I think I saw the silhouette of someone in the distance. Could he be the owner of these footprints?
There's a threatening aura in the air around the valley. I'd better be careful.)

200010064.text: (It looks like a journal of some sort.)

200010065.text:
I feel so much better since that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>old pirate</> disappeared!
He was always meddling. He got what he deserved!

200010066.text:
True that! He said he was the brother of the legendary Red Hand <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Donchun</>.
Bragging around like that... good thing the leader chased him out!

200010067.text:
Actually, I thought he would've clung to the onto boss's legs, begging for mercy.
That old man... Did he leave without a struggle because he had somewhere to be?

200010068.text:
Ha? Why the heck am I concerned about him, anyway?
This is actually a relief! Good riddance!

200010069.text:
Well, that's true.
You know what, drinks are on me today!

200010070.text:
Oh, why do I look so troubled? Well... Oh, why do I look so troubled?
Well...

200010071.text:
I actually picked up some peculiar <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mineral</> on the Highland Central Trail.
Its shape and color is so unique that I was thinking of putting it on display at my house.

200010072.text:
Ever since then, I've been the victim of constant nightmares and accidents. I figured
it must be the mineral's doing, so I left it back at the Deep Forest Graveyard.

200010074.text: Phew... I don't know how this is even possible. I head out and leave that ore on the trail every day, but by morning, it's back in my front yard.

200010075.text:
I'm pretty sure it's going to return tomorrow as well, so of course I'm worried.
Um... Can you go and make sure it's still where I left it?

200010076.text: (This must be the ore the woodcutter talked about.)

200010077.text:
(It seems like the Tree Spirit's dried sap.
They don't seem to have legs.)

200010079.text: (Since it might frighten him even more if I get into the details, I'll just say I dealt with it.)

200010080.text: Phew, thank the spirits. I'm grateful to you. I can finally sleep without feeling spooked about this.

200010081.text:
Where is the Sagewood...? I'm pretty sure
my mother said it would be around here...

200010082.text:
Huh? It's not here?
My mother lied? ...No, that's not possible!

200010083.text:
Right! The Sagewood must be playing hide-and-seek!
Oh, dear Sagewood!

200010085.text:
Leave if you have no business here!
This is sacred ground!

200010087.text:
Ah, it's a personal matter. I don't want to talk about it for too long, but I do want to vent to someone.
My father's been in and out of his mind recently.

200010088.text:
He keeps talking about some sort of tree, and he just leaves the house. It's really worrying me.
And my son Gupal keeps following after him.

200010089.text:
I'm worried sick because those two haven't returned from their last outing.
I'd like to go find them, but I have to go to work soon.

200010090.text: I can cover for you while you look for your family.

200010091.text:
Are you serious? Then, I'll take your offer for the day.
You just have to eliminate the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>spiders</> in the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Deep Forest Graveyard</>.

200010094.text: Guess what: I've met a talking tree spirit!

200010096.text:
But I swear! Go this way and then that way, and then this way, and you'll see it!
But it seems something bad happened. They were all out of energy.

200010097.text:
Oh, look at the time! I'd better get home!
Grandpa, Grandpa! I'm going back home! Dad must be worried!

200010098.text:
Foolish... person...
Over here... Help me...

200010100.text: I'm... an ancient tree. 150 years old...

200010101.text: It seems rather small for a 150-year-old tree.

200010102.text:
It's because of that despicable thing...
It's stealing my energy... and possessed my brothers.

200010103.text: Despicable thing? Who are you talking about?

200010104.text:
Red Glasir... that cursed tree possessed my brothers,
made them violent, and turned them against me...

200010105.text:
My brothers... the curse... must... release...
It's impossible alone... person...

200010106.text:
Please free my brothers from the curse.
And... return... my... power...

200010107.text:
(I feel bad for this Spirit that looks like a mummy.
I should free its brothers from the curse and return its powers.)

200010110.text:
My brothers... are now at peace...
My... power.. has returned... Thank you...

200010111.text:
But... there are still those who are suffering...
Red Glasir... Until that despicable thing disappears...

200010113.text:
(Did it just say, "Nod?"
Anyway, I'll hand it over.)

200010115.text:
Mm... Well, I have no idea what this is.
It doesn't look like I can use it for my smithing work, either.

200010116.text:
I know someone who's knowledgeable in mysterious things like this.
Have you heard of Naypaw? You should go to him.

200010117.text:
I've seen something like this before.
It wasn't that valuable.

200010118.text:
I don't think I can buy this from you.
I'm sorry I don't have the answer you're looking for.

200010119.text:
Ooooh, meow! What's this?
It looks nothing like anything found on this continent!

200010121.text:
Have you heard of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Blueskin</>?
The leaders of that bluish bunch love this thing, meow.

200010122.text:
The Blueskin look the way they do because of their greed fur shiny things, meow.
It was their punishment. The Baron Pioneers should learn from their mistake.

200010123.text: Ah, here they come, after this shiny thing, mrrow!

200010124.text: "Is that all?!" That kind of comment is easily an invitation fur them to get us!

200010125.text:
This thing is definitely cursed, meow.
I have no use fur it, so just throw it away!

200010126.text:
Remember! Greed is a friend to no one.
Later, meow.

200010127.text:
Oh my, hello!
Have you come all the way to the Plum Blossom Base for help?

200010128.text: Do you know anything about this old compass?

200010129.text:
Hmm, let's see. Ah, here! The paint has all peeled off, and I can't know if I don't examine it more closely.
This seems to be an object that belonged to the early expedition who left for the new continent ages ago.

200010130.text:
Have you perhaps heard about the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Forgotten Expedition</>?
That fleet disappeared like a ghost in the vast ocean while heading for the new continent.

200010131.text:
Rumor has it that there was a full-out mutiny on the ship.
But nobody knows the truth, since the ship went missing and the expedition never returned.

200010132.text: Thank you! I expected nothing less from an Explorer.

200010133.text: (Some strange man is waving his hand.)

200010135.text:
(Hm, now he's even nodding his head at me!
He looks suspicious, but I'm kind of intrigued.)

200010136.text: (I should at least listen to what he has to say.)

200010137.text:
Hm, I thought I did a good job disguising myself.
How did you know I was calling you?

200010138.text:
Where did you find that branch?
It's bringing attention to you.

200010139.text:
You don't know what you're talking about.
I called you because of the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Chivalry Quest Board</>.

200010140.text:
See the bulletin board over there? That's the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Chivalry Quest Board</>, with requests from various organizations hanging on it.
And the mysterious-looking person standing next to it is the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Enigma Council</> supervisor of this area.

200010141.text:
Huh? You don't know what the Enigma Council is? Are you serious?
The Enigma Council is an agency of justice, brokering and managing requests from everywhere. Geez, how do you not know?

200010142.text:
Ah, especially, she's—ah! Ah, ah, never mind.
I-I support the Enigma Council purely for the prosperity of Moonwater Harbor!

200010143.text: A-ahem! The more Chivalry quests are carried out, the more successful she—I mean, Moonwater Harbor—becomes.

200010144.text:
You look like you have too much time on your hands. You look strong, too. The Enigma Council could use people like you!
Come on, at least go check out the Chivalry Quest Board, won't you?

200010145.text:
(I don't like the way he talks, but he seems legit.
I should tell him that I'll at least go check the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Chivalry Quest Board</>.)

200010146.text: (This must be the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Chivalry Quest Board</> that the strange man told me about.)

200010147.text: (I guess I should check it often in case some useful jobs pop up.)

200010148.text: (This must be the Nature Society Base.)

200010149.text: (Could he be the leader of this place? I should go talk to him.)

200010150.text:
I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Gray Breeze</>, the leader of this lot.
The situation around these parts is turbulent at best. You should leave this place while you still can.

200010151.text: Is it because of the Poacher Gang?

200010152.text:
Yes. The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Poacher Gang</> has been illegally poaching animals left and right.
That has negatively affected the Sapphire Basin's ecosystem.

200010153.text:
Their actions have gotten bolder recently.
We've even lost a few rangers.

200010154.text:
I'll reward you for your efforts if you get rid of the evil Poacher Gang
and help me administer first aid to the wounded animals.

200010155.text:
(The Nature Society seems to hate the Poacher Gang.
I'll offer my help for the sake of the Sapphire Basin.)

200010156.text: Okay, did you do what I asked?

200010158.text:
You're better than you look. Thank you.
We've managed to push the Poacher Gang back for now.

200010159.text:
Do you mind helping us every now and then?
I'll make sure to reward you handsomely.

200010160.text:
You're still here? I understand.
This place is as good as any if you're looking to explore the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Barren Ruins</>, meow.

200010161.text: Do you know a lot about the Barren Ruins?

200010162.text:
Of course I do! I, Naypaw, of the Baron Pioneers
have set up camp here for that very reason after all, meow!

200010163.text:
We're researching the relationship between the Protectors and the Ruins.
These ruins really get our explorer blood boiling, meow!

200010164.text:
Since we're on the topic, don't you want to meet the other members of our group?
They should be around here somewhere. Tell them I'm looking fur them, meow!

200010165.text: Finally, conclusive evidence to reveal the source of these Protectors...!

200010166.text:
Huh? It's true!
I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Poofur</> of the Baron Pioneers. I'm a jack-of-all-trades, meow!

200010168.text:
He is? All right, meow!
I'll be right there!

200010170.text:
Hmm, purr... beats me. We agreed to go about on our own missions.
They might be around here somewhere...

200010171.text:
Look for them over there, meow!
I'll go see the leader first!

200010172.text:
(With the sudden increase in Protectors, the Barons who were unable to flee in time are asking for help.
It's most likely <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pahpaw</>.)

200010173.text:
Whew. you're my savior! Thank you so much, meow.
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pahpaw</> almost met his maker.

200010174.text:
What? The leader is looking for us? This is bad...
He's going to be angry if he knows that I didn't complete my mission yet, mrrow...

200010175.text: I won't tell on you, I promise.

200010176.text:
Really? We're going to get along just fine. Purrrr!
Well then, let's go back to our leader, meow!

200010177.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>! Where and what were you doing?
Didn't I ask you to find the other members? Should you really be the last one to get here, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>?

200010178.text:
(Just as I was about to say that I was the one who gathered everyone here,
Poofur and Pahpaw started fidgeting.)

200010179.text:
My goodness, you can't even complete such a simple task.
This won't do. I, Naypaw, will take you under my wing and make an upstanding person out of you, meow!

200010180.text:
From today forward, you're an <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>honorary member of the Baron Pioneers</>! Well? Aren't you proud?
I'll bestow you the honor of working alongside us and learning new things, meow!

200010181.text:
(Someone is lying on the grass over there.
It looks pretty dangerous to lounge around here.)

200010183.text:
(I'll try to shake him awake, but
it's not easy to wake <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pahpaw</> up.)

200010184.text:
Huh... the mission... <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>basket</>... not here...?
Hm... Pahpaw... The <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>grass</>... tastes great...

200010185.text:
(Seems he couldn't resist the temptation and ate all the grass.
I think Pahpaw will wake up eventually while I help with the quest.)

200010186.text:
Ah, aren't you a member of the honorary Baron Pioneers, purr?
Why do you have my basket in your hands? Give that back, meow!

200010187.text:
Phew! I remember now.
Pahpaw was investigating the plant life in this region, purr.

200010188.text:
I found this grass while doing that! Look, meow!
I even named it myself. This is Baron Grass!

200010189.text:
This grass is common in Sapphire Basin.
You almost failed your mission because you couldn't resist it.

200010190.text:
Nonsense! Are you just jealous that I found something amazing?
Stop spouting nonsense. I'm busy, meow!

200010191.text: (I want to explain further, but Pahpaw seems too angry to listen to me.)

200010192.text:
Aren't you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>?
Of course. Now isn't a vewy goodtime, though, meow...

200010194.text:
Do you see those wild <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>bears</> and <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>saberfangs</> over there?
Poofur needs to bring their <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>furs</> to our leader by today, mrrow.

200010195.text:
I followed you over here, but... Isn't this a bit too scawy, meow? 
Look at their sharp teeth and claws. They'll rip poor Poofur apart...

200010196.text:
(Poofur won't be able to take on a bear or a saberfang. I'll offer
to help him.)

200010197.text:
Really? Whew. It's those guys over there!
Oh, and don't furget! Don't ruin their fur, meow!

200010198.text:
Did you bring enough? Hmm... I think some of them are ruined.
But this should be good enough. The leader will be pleased, meow!

200010199.text: What will you use the fur for?

200010200.text: Heh heh... <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, did you know there are two ways to make a person angry, mrrow?

200010201.text:
The first is abruptly stopping in the middle of a sentence...
And the second is...

200010202.text: (I'll just wait for Poofur to continue.)

200010203.text:
Whew... I was almost killed, meow. This is all Pahpaw's fault!
Even the leader said so himself! That's not how you're supposed to explore! You must be vewy careful...

200010204.text:
Mrrow... I was pretty certain this place would hold a lot of treasure...
Ah, aren't you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>? Poofur, look! We're going to be okay!

200010205.text: I'm not sure I understand, but are you all right?

200010206.text:
Don't even get me started! Pahpaw and Poofur did it again, meow!
They were in the middle of an important excavating task...

200010207.text:
hey found a <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>mysterious cave</>, mrrow.
We were sure that it would hold treasures beyond our wildest dreams, so we just went in.

200010208.text:
Before we knew what was going on, Protectors were on top of us, hiss!
We just barely managed to escape with our lives.

200010209.text:
What do I even tell the leader at this point?
He'll say I can't even complete a simple task, but it's not like I can take on those monstrous things... Mrrow...

200010210.text:
Oh, right! Listen to Poofur and Pahpaw's amazing suggestion, meow!
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, you're an honorary Baron Pioneer member, right?

200010211.text:
Yeah, it's really you, <myHero.name/>! Let's excavate that cave together and get a medallion from the leader, purr!
Poofur and Pahpaw will stay here and guard the entrance so <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></> can venture deeper! Hurry, meow!

200010212.text:
What? You want to take part in the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Hesuth hunt</>?
You look so frail, though. Do you even know what you're doing?

200010213.text:
Hunting Hesuth isn't as easy as you might think.
You could even call it the pinnacle of hunting and survival!

200010215.text:
Oh? Look at you! Hahaha! You've got guts, I'll give you that!
However, I'm going to need to see you in action first.

200010216.text:
Hunting Hesuth doesn't come cheap.
I can't just invest in someone who I don't even know, can I?

200010217.text:
Do you see those ugly miscreants over there?
I'll think favorably of you once you hunt them and give me some proof of your hunt.

200010218.text:
Wh-what? You're back already?
Ahem. You're better than I thought!

200010219.text:
Even so, you're no match for me. I'm Jimmy Ace, after all.
Fine! You can join the Hesuth hunting expedition!

200010220.text:
I'm against this idea, boss.
How would he even be useful?

200010221.text:
I agree!
Why would we even let him join us?

200010222.text:
Be quiet! You guys can't even pull your own weight.
Hm, anyway, you! Wait right here. We need to discuss something before we recruit you.

200010223.text: (There's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>corpse</> over there. Maybe I can find clues about the Hesuth?)

200010224.text: (Let's clear out the wild animals that are hindering my progress.)

200010225.text:
(<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>It has the power</> to slay a wild animal in one blow.
The body is still warm, so that monster must still be lurking nearby.)

200010228.text: (Let's clear out the wild animals that are getting in the way of my investigation.)

200010229.text:
(This corpse has the same wound as the one I saw before.
However, there seems to be amber embedded in this body.)

200010230.text: (The trail ends here. The Hesuth must be nearby.)

200010231.text:
Hm hm, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Jimmy Ace</> knew you would be able to handle it!
Ok-okay. Tell me how you found it.

200010233.text:
Ah! So, that's how you did it! I-I mean, ahem.
Of course, I know how you did it.

200010235.text:
What? Now? N-no... Now isn't a good time. Uh, I don't have any weapons...
And considering the size of its lair, it's got to be gigantic...

200010236.text:
Y-yeah! You should do it! I could probably kill it in an instant,
but if I did, you wouldn't have a chance to fight it.

200010237.text:
I shall bestow you the honor of fighting a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Michelia</>!
Go, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>!

200010238.text:
Ah! <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>! How fortunate!
I thought we'd be separated and never find each other again.

200010240.text:
The work of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron Pioneers</> at the Sapphire Basin is finished.
We're going to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol</> to finally fulfill our dream!

200010241.text: Tada, meow! We've got a permit to explore Haewol!

200010242.text: We're going to board that humongous ship headed for Haewol, purr!

200010243.text: Congratulations! I'm going to Haewol, too.

200010244.text:
Is that right? That's good to hear!
Then, how about heading over with us, mrrow?

200010246.text:
Is that so? Ah! Then, I've got a gift prepared for you, purr!
I was looking for you so that I could give you this!

200010248.text:
You wish! An honorary Baron Pioneer shouldn't just have things handed to them!
I've hid it somewhere inside the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Soul Bridge</>. Good luck finding it, purr!

200010249.text:
It's the last quest for our honorary Baron Pioneer, meow!
Stay well! I'll see you later!

200010250.text:
Oh, <myHero.name/>! I thought you left for Haewol!
Have you changed your mind, by any chance?

200010251.text: (I'll ask for a permit after explaining Naypaw's situation.)

200010252.text:
Something like that...! Of course, I'll help.
It's partly my fault for not going around and seeing the situation on the ground with my own eyes.

200010253.text:
However, even with my authority as the temporary owner,
it is against the law to issue a permit to a pioneer who has not been properly certified.

200010255.text:
I need to be able to prove that the Baron Pioneers are a group that is working toward the interests of Sapphire Basin.
I have just the task in mind.

200010256.text:
Most anglers here make a living off of fishing.
However, with the Lake Turtles disrupting the ecosystem, it has led to a significant decrease in their catch.

200010257.text:
Moreover, these Lake Turtles even rip apart the fishing nets set by the fishermen, making the situation even worse.
If you deal with this, I'll give you a permit.

200010258.text:
Just as I expected of you, <myHero.name/>.
The fishermen have expressed their gratitude for your actions.

200010259.text:
I declare that the Baron Pioneers represent our interests
and I hereby issue you a permit.

200010260.text:
They should be able to operate within the boundaries of this country
with relative freedom. I hope this helps.

200010262.text:
This is... Mehwa's permit! Very well. We acknowledge that 
the Baron Pioneers' activities are legal. We will withdraw at once.

200010263.text:
I was certain it was the end of the Baron Pioneers...
Sniff... It's all thanks to you, meow!

200010264.text:
I want to repay you in kind... 
If time allows, come to Moonwater Harbor, mrrow!

200010265.text:
You came! <myHero.name/>, I was just telling them how you helped me.
Poofur and Pahpaw are also grateful fur your help, meow!

200010266.text:
We started receiving funds after our group's activities were officially authorized.
We plan on using this capital to fund our pioneering in the new continent, purr!

200010268.text:
It's all thanks to you!
It's nothing much, but I've prepared a small gift, meow.

200010269.text: (I'll wait for them to present the gift.)

200010270.text:
Eh, it won't be fun to just give it to you straight.
You're an honorary member of our pioneering group! Find it, purr!

200010271.text:
Head to the greenest place in Moonwater Harbor.
You'll find it once you dig in the ground below you, meow!

200010272.text:
This is the last mission I'm going to give you!
Thank you for everything you've done! Farewell honorary Baron Pioneer <myHero.name/>, meow!

200010273.text:
(I found a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pile of dirt</> after arriving here.
The ground looks like it's been disturbed. Let's try digging!)

200010276.text:
As you can tell by my clothes, I'm an <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Elucidator Scholar</>. Name's <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Min Kyunghan</>.
It's our job to record history that has been handed down through the ages in the Sapphire Basin.

200010277.text:
In particular, that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Fable</> on the rock over there is a piece that our leader worked a lot on.
Our leader comes by from time to time, just to gaze upon it.

200010278.text:
I believe it has something to do with our leader's memories...
But his name isn't exactly written upon the Fable, so I wouldn't know for certain.

200010279.text:
But, look here. Someone tried to destroy the Fable!
They most likely were jealous of the deeds achieved by the warrior depicted within this Fable!

200010281.text:
If I did, I wouldn't be standing around like this...
I'm trying to find the culprit, but it's too much to handle for an ordinary scholar like me.

200010283.text:
Are you going to help me? Do you see that broken Fable on that cliff beyond the bridge?
Seeing how they were able to get up there, they must be a warrior of some repute.

200010284.text:
I've found more Fables in the direction he ran off to.
Please teach him a lesson before he causes more trouble!

200010285.text:
(Seems like someone already damaged it.
Looks like it happened not too long ago...)

200010286.text:
W-what!? I've been caught red-handed.
Mind your own business and get lost!

200010287.text: (That person seems strange. Let's go after him.)

200010288.text:
Yeah... It's true I broke the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Fables</>,
but I did it for a reason!

200010289.text:
The person depicted within these Fables killed my brother and yet, he was written off as a hero!
Blasphemy!

200010290.text:
He is my family's enemy!
He's not someone who should be written on some monument like a hero!

200010292.text:
Even if it happened due to a misunderstanding...
My dead brother isn't coming back from the dead!

200010293.text:
I had nowhere else to vent my anger.
I tried going to the Elucidator Scholars to tell them about my side of the story but they wouldn't listen to me...

200010294.text:
Anyways, it's true that I shouldn't have broken these Fables,
and for that I do apologize. Send my regards to them for me.

200010295.text:
Ah, that's right! Do you think you can get some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>samples</> from that extraordinary being?
I'm sure the bearer of this specimen has to be something more than just a Hollow.

200010296.text:
I'm asking you because if an unskilled person tries to fight it,
they'll be the ones to be defeated.

200010298.text:
R-really? Wow... I'm already itching with anticipation! I will reward you handsomely,
so please! I'll leave it in your capable hands!

200010299.text:
Oh my, did you wait long?
We haven't had a new recruit in a while, so it took us a bit longer than usual.

200010300.text:
Anyway, we have come to an unprecedented decision.
I, Jimmy Ace of the Hesuth hunters, have decided to give you a very special opportunity.

200010302.text:
You will personally track Hesuth and find out where its nest is.
Although I'm not sure a novice like you can do the job.

200010303.text: Tsk, you'd be lucky if they didn't run away just because it's hard.

200010304.text: That's right! We're having a pretty tough time right now. Oh!

200010305.text:
Hmph! Of course. I know where Hesuth is hiding, but I'm doing this
because I care about you. Opportunities like this don't come by very often.

200010306.text:
Well? I care about you so much! Aren't you grateful? Right? Hahahaha!
Now, when you find out Hesuth's location, signal me!

200010307.text:
The tyranny of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blue Bandits</> is getting worse every day, and now we have no more food to offer them for our lives.
The residents in the area have left with what they could take.

200010308.text:
I've stayed because I couldn't leave my precious home, which I obtained after struggling all my life.
I am finally abandoning this place, tired of living with this anxiety, staying up sleepless nights.

200010309.text:
If someone reads this board, hear my plea and stop the Blue Bandits' tyranny.
Help us so that the residents who were forced to leave against their will may return.

200010310.text:
(The writing on the board looks pretty shaky... The writer must have been really terrified.
I'll do what I can for the safety of Sapphire Basin and the sake of the residents, so they can one day return to their homes.)

200010311.text:
Poor fellow...
It's such a pity...

200010313.text:
As you know, the environment here is suitable for the wild animals to survive,
but there are too many dangers for them.

200010314.text:
As you've seen, the Poacher Gang's indiscriminate hunting is only one of the threats to the wildlife.
A group of Ravenous Saberfangs has also appeared recently.

200010315.text:
How could the weak, wild animals survive against the Ravenous Saberfangs?
That's why they were found wounded or already dead.

200010316.text: (The stag's eyes look so sad... I might've been able to help.)

200010317.text:
If you help, I can focus on curing this little one.
Please... Save the poor wild animals from danger.

200010318.text:
(I'll relay that since the Ravenous Saberfangs of the Highland Central Trail have been taken care of,
the wild animals won't be threatened for a while.)

200010319.text:
Really? Thanks to you, our little friend will be able to return to its family soon.
It'll still require some more time, but I'm indebted to you!

200010321.text:
I'm sorry if I was rude. I'm just frustrated because of that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Poacher Gang</>.
If we keep responding to them so passively, they'll keep doing whatever they want.

200010322.text:
I keep saying that it'll be much more effective to ambush their base...
But I was told to not create any more unnecessary conflict.

200010323.text:
So, I decided to do things my way. I've already gathered others who feel the same way I do.
The planned ambush will take place soon. But, will you really help us?

200010324.text:
The plan was a success!
You're pretty useful, aren't you?

200010325.text:
The Nature Society seem to have changed their minds after this ambush.
We can get rid of them for good at this rate. Thank you!

200010326.text: You there, could you do me a favor?

200010327.text:
That poor child. I'm sorry about what happened to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sohyang's family</>.
I couldn't help on that little child's last journey, and that's been on my mind ever since.

200010328.text:
As you know, the path there is teeming with all kinds of dangerous creatures.
You've been there once. I was thinking perhaps you could go with her family.

200010329.text: (I should go to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Deep Forest Graveyard</> with the village chief's story and tell them to get ready to leave.)

200010330.text:
You're going to come with us?
Finally... We can see Sohyang!

200010331.text:
Thank you so much. We can go wherever you want.
We'll follow you from a safe distance, so we won't slow you down.

200010332.text:
Good heavens... My Sohyang... This grave...
Sohyang... Sohyang... Mother's here, Sohyang!

200010333.text:
Thank you for allowing me to say my goodbye to Sohyang.
Now, I can let her go.

200010334.text:
Oh, it's a person! Wait!
How do I look right now? Do I look like a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Dokkaebi</>?

200010335.text: (A Dokkaebi is talking to me? I don't know if I should run away...)

200010336.text:
It's her! Argh! It's all because of that Boknu girl!
She bragged about becoming rich by using a Dokkaebi club, but that was a lie.

200010337.text:
I swung the club that the Dokkaebi gave me on that hill, and look at me now.
Look at this! I'm a Dokkaebi now?

200010338.text:
I'm looking for the Dokkaebi who made me look like this, but I can't find them!
So, I need to use my head to get back at the reprehensible Dokkaebi.

200010339.text:
Since <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Dokkaebi</> don't like red beans, so I thought I could mix red beans in the food
and torture them a bit to smoke them out. Can you help me?

200010340.text:
Stop, stop!
What is it that you want!?

200010341.text:
The whole forest reeks of red beans!
Everyone of my kind has stomachaches from it!

200010342.text: All those of my kind are trembling from fear!

200010343.text: (I should tell them about the strange Dokkaebi and ask them to return her to normal.)

200010344.text:
Hmph, people's greed knows no end!
They're greedy, even after we gave them the club!

200010345.text:
Knock, knock! Now there! She will be back to normal!
I'm sorry this little prank went overboard! Now please, don't make us suffer anymore!

200010346.text:
I thought I would have to live as a Dokkaebi for the rest of my life!
Thank you! I won't ever even look in the direction of this forest. I'll get going!

200010347.text:
Achoooo! Oh, I haven't seen you around.
I'm the last worker at the Sapphire Ranch after all the workers ran away. Achoo!

200010349.text:
Loyalty? Achoo! What are you talking about? 
That's been dead for a long time. I'm doing it for the money.

200010350.text:
But it looks like I've reached my limit.
 Achoo! This is driving me nuts.

200010351.text:
Look at me. I don't know why, but this hasn't stopped.
There must be some sort of pollen in the air. Achoo! I'm really sensitive to that stuff.

200010352.text:
I tried my best to stay. The pay here is the best.
Ugh, the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Bulbari</> over there must be spreading something. Achoo!

200010353.text:
I'd like to do something about it, but as you can see, I can't even get close to them.
Could you get rid of them for me? I'll give you some of my pay.

200010354.text:
Wow, that's more like it!
It's still a little itchy, but I'm feeling a lot better. Thanks!

200010355.text:
Greetings, plog! I am the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ploggles'</> Blacksmith, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Mowa</>!
I don't know if you know, but we're preparing a hunt to retake our village, plog.

200010356.text:
Our warriors can't pierce their leather with the weapons they have,
and the armor our warriors are wearing can't stop their teeth.

200010357.text:
So, I gave it some thought.
If we equip our warriors with weapon and armor created with their <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>leather</> and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</>, we might have a good chance, plog.

200010358.text: Isn't it better if I just eliminate them all?

200010359.text:
It's very nice of you to say that. But you can solve nothing with such a shortsighted solution.
It's a trial we Ploggles must overcome, so I would like to try to take a long-term approach to this, plog.

200010360.text: If you could help us, please, plog. Please collect as many leathers and teeth as you can!

200010361.text:
You've collected so much!
It'll be more than enough to equip our warriors, plog.

200010362.text:
Thank you, plog. We will remember 
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>'s help on the day we retake our village!

200010363.text:
Do you see that deep <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>hole</> over there? Your job is to collect various <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>samples</> from there.
The more you bring, the more we'll pay! How about it? Do you want to try it?

200010364.text:
It troubles me to give you such a dangerous job, but I'll leave it to you.
I'll quickly go and get my family.

200010365.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, I think there are other Awakened Corridors around here.
Actually, there's one that I'm particularly interested in.

200010366.text:
See that one over there?
Why don't you go check it out while I look elsewhere?

200010367.text: Don't you want to check it yourself?

200010368.text:
Well, now that I know you're strong enough to explore Awakened Corridors,
I think it's best we split up and search.

200010369.text:
And there's something special about you. I just don't know what it could be.
I'm hoping I can find that out while exploring the Corridors with you.

200010371.text:
Great. Since the road back is tougher than it looks, it's better to go to the front of the Corridor using Windstride.
Don't forget to tell me when you find the Caelite! I'll see you later!

200010372.text: Ooh, who knew there was also an Awakened Corridor here?

200010373.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, did you check it out already?

200010375.text:
Alright, you found it. You check it first.
In the meantime, I'll look someplace else.

200010376.text:
Oh, let me know if you find any Caelite.
I'll come at once, wherever you are.

200010377.text: It must have been quite tempting as a researcher... it's a shame.

200010378.text:
That's what I said. It's frustrating, though, because I can't go into the pit where the Hollows are.
I want to find those Fables, but I don't even know where they could be.

200010379.text:
Could you look for the Fables for me? I don't need too many.
Just one or two? If you can deliver the words written on the Fable, I'll pay you.

200010380.text: (I'll describe the Fable I found in the Bottomless Pit.)

200010381.text:
What you've described is a valuable record.
Thank you so much. Then, here's your reward.

200010382.text:
We learned all this from the manual. I really shouldn't, but may I keep this?
I might be able to use it myself if I fix it! Haha.

200010383.text:
(This human footprint leads inside the valley.
Why would someone even go there? I'm curious.)

20014512.text: (Huh? Is there some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>letter</> in a place like this?)

20014513.text: (Did it even come from the sea?)

20014514.text: (Seals with unusual patterns stand out. This is the first time I've seen a sealing method like this.\nCan I just open it like this?)

20014515.text: <textColor=[207:213:185:255]><Wow, I heard the rumors!</>\n<textColor=[207:213:185:255]>You said you had a good time with the cuties?</>

20014516.text: <textColor=[207:213:185:255]>Bee, bad. Having fun alone</> <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Saturated eggs</><textColor=[207:213:185:255]>I also want to play!</>\n<textColor! =[207:213:185:255]>Play with me~ We</> <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Nari</><textColor=[207:213:185:255]> </> <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Soothe</><textColor=[207:213:185:255]> Together with you~</>

20014517.text: <textColor=[207:213:185:255]>I am special to you</> <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sea snake supply base</><textColor=[207:213:185:255 ]> asked permission to enter.</>\n<textColor=[207:213:185:255]>This is special treatment. Please come! Got it?</> <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Saturated egg</><textColor=[207:213:185:255]>This!></>

20014518.text: (<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Saturated egg</> seems to be an invitation to someone.\nBut this <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sea snake supply base< Where is />...?)

20014520.text: (Besides, what is this strange aura that is leaking minutely from the correspondence?\nIt doesn't seem like an ordinary correspondence)

20014521.text: (First, let's find out where the letter came from.\nI wonder if... <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>He</>is here on Suwol Plain?)

20014522.text: (As expected, I am very happy to confirm that Perong Perong is at Younggyowon)

20014523.text: Perong pero long~! No, what are you doing here?\nHave you come to visit this old man? Then it was a good time, heh heh!

20014524.text: (After receiving the greeting from Perong Perong, who smiles happily, he handed over a letter and asked for an inspection)

20014525.text: Hororon...? Nothing difficult, right? Uh-huh, so slow!\nMore is in such a hurry... Let's see... Perorong...?

20014526.text: Where the hell did you get your hands on something like this?\nThis letter must be... from outside the world!

20014528.text: It means that we do not belong to the timeline where we live.\nLook carefully. The status of this correspondence!

20014529.text: Tits... The distortion seems to have already begun.\nAs long as this letter stays here, the distortion will gradually accelerate... Maybe...!

20014530.text: Left and right! It would be better to return it to its original place as soon as possible.\nThe sooner the better!

20014531.text: (However, according to Perong Perong, the source of this letter has crossed the timeline.\nHe asks how he can get to a place he does not know at all)

20014532.text: Perong... Even this old man has never done teleportation that crosses the timeline before.\nThat's a very dangerous thing to do. It's difficult... Cancer...!

20014533.text: However! Who else can do it but this old man? Perorong~\nNow, close your eyes and focus your mind. From now on, I'll send it to the source of the letter.

20014535.text: Oh, you've come back safely!\nIn any case, this old man almost ran out of breath.

20014536.text: (Thanks to you, everything seems to have found its place, but it is said that it is very dreary)

20014537.text: I feel the same way. I managed to fix it, but it shouldn't have happened in the first place!

20014538.text: However, as mere creatures, we must have done our best.\nWe have no choice but to leave the rest to the God of Time...

20014539.text: Still, if you really care, it'll be fine to take a peek at it from time to time.\nWith friends you can trust.

20014540.text: You seem to already know how to do it, so I'll stop worrying and go first.\nBecause it's been a long time since then. Porolong~
